text: The best screen actor is the man who can do nothing extremely well.
author: ALFRED HITCHCOCK

text: The darkest hour in any man's life is when he sits down to plan how to get money without earning it.
author: HORACE GREELEY

text: There are only three real sports: bull-fighting, car racing and mountain climbing. All the others are mere games.
author: ERNEST HEMINGWAY

text: The world is but a school of enquiry.
author: MICHAEL DE MONTAIGNE

text: An economist is an expert who will know tomorrow why the things he predicted yesterday didn't happen today.
author: EVAN ESAR

text: Love is the delightful interval between meeting a beautiful girl and discovering that she looks like a haddock.
author: JOHN BARRYMORE

text: I think, therefore I get paid
author: UNKNOWN
